channel.title: Safe Zones
channel.description:
[i]Well lol, i've never made a safe zone, weirdly enough. I'd like to know if the tut 'Making safe zones' covers pimpscape too..cause it only says test If it doesn't how do you do it in pimp
Thanks -Killah246[/i]

item.title: Safe Zones
item.dc:creator: @koopa_king koopa king
item.description:
@koopa_king wrote:

Go into your client.java file and hit ctrl + f.

Then type in

public boolean nonWild

Then when you see

|| (absX >= #### && absX <= #### && absY >= #### && absY<= ####)

You are in the right section. You then have to add in your own coordinates on what you want to be a safe zone.

Pretty much what

 absX >= #### && absX <= ####

is saying is that any X value between the two numbers is safe.

Ex:

 absX >= 3493 && absX <= 3500

^ That means that any X-value between the value of 3493 and 3500 will be safe. Then you need to put in your Y-values so that you don’t just have a strip going across your map that is safe. So in fact, you are basically making a box for your safe area.

                       [v absY <= ####]
                       --------X---------
                       |                       |
                       |                       |

[absX >= #### >] X X [< absX <= ####]
| |
| |
--------X---------
[^ absY >= ####]

I hope my drawing makes it easy for you to understand it. =/

Read full topic

item.title: Safe Zones
item.dc:creator: @killah246 Killah246
item.description:
@killah246 wrote:

[quote=“teric6, post:8, topic:93466”]Well you need to route your safe zone to create an imaginary square.

So find the top right corner of where you want your safe zone to be, and take noted of the X and Y co-ords.

Then go to the bottom left end of where you want your safe zone to be and take the co-ords.

Now In public void non Wild it will start off saying

if((absX >= THE SMALLEST X CO-ORD OF THE TOP RIGHT OR BOTTOM LEFT PART OF YOUR SAFE ZONE!

Replace that with the smallest X co-ords of them you just noted, then go on to the second one, thats the biggest X co-ords of the ones you just noted, then do the same for the Y co-ords.[/quote]

OK I think i get ya now thanks

Read full topic

item.title: Safe Zones
item.dc:creator: @teric6 teric6
item.description:
@teric6 wrote:

Well you need to route your safe zone to create an imaginary square.

So find the top right corner of where you want your safe zone to be, and take noted of the X and Y co-ords.

Then go to the bottom left end of where you want your safe zone to be and take the co-ords.

Now In public void non Wild it will start off saying

if((absX >= THE SMALLEST X CO-ORD OF THE TOP RIGHT OR BOTTOM LEFT PART OF YOUR SAFE ZONE!

Replace that with the smallest X co-ords of them you just noted, then go on to the second one, thats the biggest X co-ords of the ones you just noted, then do the same for the Y co-ords.

item.description:
@I_Metal_I wrote:

go to the north east cornor get the coords put them in like this

if((absX >= NE && absX <= SW && absY >= NE && absY <=SW ) ||

go like that and make it a safe zone

item.title: Safe Zones
item.dc:creator: @teric6 teric6
item.description:
@teric6 wrote:

firslty find the top right corner of the safe zone you want.

Then go and find the bottom left corner

Take noted of the co-ords

find in clinet.java

public boolean nonWild() {

Beneath you will see

if((absX >= 3249 && absX <= 3258 && absY >= 3438 && absY <=3431 ) ||

where it says

if((absX >= 3249

that is the smallest X co-ord.

absX <= 3258

^^ the next is the biggest X co-ord.

Same goes with the 2 Y co-ords.

You have to find the top right corner of your safe zone and the bottom left corner, and organise the co-ords from smalelst X to beggest X then smallest Y to biggest Y.

Thanks

Read full topic
